Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I'm new to the forum. My husband (70yo) was diagnosed with stage T2b, gleason score 7 prostate cancer in July 2017. He has been seeing an oncologist at Sloan Kettering Cancer Center and they are recommending SHARP (Stereotactic Hypofractionated Accelerated Radiation Therapy). It sounds good with only 5 radiation treatments instead of the 40-45 with other treatments. His appointment to have the markers inserted is in November and I was looking for anyone who has gone through this before. I can't find much info on it searching the internet. I would like to hear experiences from other people.
Posts.Title: SHARP Radiation Therapy

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone for your great comments. I will be doing some internet research this weekend with the sites you referred. Dr. Zelefky will be doing the insertion of markers and rectal spacer on Nov 9. Its nice to hear that people know who he is and the positive reputation he has.
